Package org.neo4j.kernel.api.impl.index.storage

Class PartitionedIndexStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.kernel.api.impl.index.storage.PartitionedIndexStorage
  • public class PartitionedIndexStorage
extends Object
    Utility class that manages directory structure for a partitioned lucene index. It is aware of the file system structure of all index related folders, lucene directories and failure storage.

      • openDirectory

        public org.apache.lucene.store.Directory openDirectory​(Path folder)
                                                throws IOException
        Opens a lucene directory for the given folder.
        Parameters:
        folder - the folder that denotes a lucene directory.
        Returns:
        the lucene directory denoted by the given folder.
        Throws:
        IOException - if directory can't be opened.

      • getPartitionFolder

        public Path getPartitionFolder​(int partition)
        Resolves a folder for the partition with the given index.
        Parameters:
        partition - the partition index.
        Returns:
        the folder where partition's lucene directory should be located.

      • getIndexFolder

        public Path getIndexFolder()
        Resolves root folder for the given index.
        Returns:
        the folder containing index partition folders.

      • reserveIndexFailureStorage

        public void reserveIndexFailureStorage()
                                throws IOException
        Create a failure storage in the index folder.
        Throws:
        IOException - if failure storage creation fails.
        See Also:
        FailureStorage.reserveForIndex()

      • storeIndexFailure

        public void storeIndexFailure​(String failure)
                       throws IOException
        Writes index failure into the failure storage.
        Parameters:
        failure - the cause of the index failure.
        Throws:
        IOException - if writing to the failure storage file failed.
        See Also:
        FailureStorage.storeIndexFailure(String)

      • getStoredIndexFailure

        public String getStoredIndexFailure()
        Retrieves stored index failure.
        Returns:
        index failure as string or null if there is no failure.
        See Also:
        FailureStorage.loadIndexFailure()

      • prepareFolder

        public void prepareFolder​(Path folder)
                   throws IOException
        For the given folder removes all nested folders from both file system and lucene directories.
        Parameters:
        folder - the folder to clean up.
        Throws:
        IOException - if some removal operation fails.

      • cleanupFolder

        public void cleanupFolder​(Path folder)
                   throws IOException
        For the given folder removes the folder itself and all nested folders from both file system and lucene directories.
        Parameters:
        folder - the folder to remove.
        Throws:
        IOException - if some removal operation fails.

      • openIndexDirectories

        public Map<Path,​org.apache.lucene.store.Directory> openIndexDirectories()
                                                                       throws IOException
        Opens all lucene directories contained in the index folder.
        Returns:
        the map from file system directory to the corresponding lucene directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - if opening of some lucene directory (via DirectoryFactory.open(Path)) fails.

      • listFolders

        public List<Path> listFolders()
        List all folders in the index folder.
        Returns:
        the list of index partition folders or empty list if index folder is empty.

      • listFolders

        private List<Path> listFolders​(Path rootFolder)

      • cleanupLuceneDirectory

        private void cleanupLuceneDirectory​(Path folder)
                             throws IOException
        Removes content of the lucene directory denoted by the given file. This might seem unnecessary since we cleanup the folder using file system but in fact for testing we often use in-memory directories whose content can't be removed via the file system.

        Uses FileUtils.windowsSafeIOOperation(FileUtils.Operation) underneath.

        Parameters:
        folder - the path to the directory to cleanup.
        Throws:
        IOException - if removal operation fails.
